intro: Licania gracilipes, commonly known as the slender licania, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy fruits. Licania gracilipes is often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
